page.title: 04THE VILLAGE OF ABERNYTE
page.content: Abernyte village is a compact village in the Sidlaw Hills above the Carse of Gowrie by the Nyte Burn.79 people live in the 27 houses.16 are about 120 year old stone cottages,11 are cottages,2 of them were crofts and have hay lofts with outbuildings & 3 large stone houses.There is an old cottage which was the shoe makers shop but is now used for a paper house where everyone puts their old papers. The old smithy is now the village shop The old houses are on the S.of the road,houses built from 1965_1978 are on the N.E. side of the road and are brick or prefabricated.At the bottom of the village are 4 houses built in 1953 by the council.3 are still council houses 1 was privately bought in 1985.The quiet village of Abernyte has neat gardens. The village street winds down in between the houses.
